rationale: Development of application systems and software that use underlying architecture of machines efficiently and effectively requires the ability to use and manipulate various types of Data Structures and other constructs. This being a fundamental ability which is language neutral yet requires use of a language for its implementation. As far as data structures are concerned, the course covers Python dictionaries as well as classes and objects for defining user defined data types such as linked lists and binary search trees. This course is designed to develop an integrated ability to efficient software development and apply the knowledge to various application systems; hence this course is very important for IT diploma engineers.
competency: Implement various types of data structures algorithms using python.

courseOutcomes.description: Understand linear and non-linear data structures.
Implement Object Oriented Programming concepts in Python.
Implement basic data structures such as stacks, queues and linked lists.
Apply Algorithms for solving problems like searching and sorting of data.
Implement nonlinear data structures like trees.

practicalExercises.description: Write a program to read a list of elements. Modify this list so that it does not contain any duplicate elements, i.e., all elements occurring multiple times in the list should appear only once.
Build a program to count the frequency of words appearing in a string using a dictionary.
Implement a Program for two matrix multiplication using simple nested loop and numpy module.
Implement basic operations on arrays.
Design an employee class for reading and displaying the employee information, the getInfo() and displayInfo() methods will be used respectively. Where getInfo() will be a private method.
Design a class Complex for adding the two complex numbers and also show the use of constructor.
Design a class for single level inheritance using public and private type derivation.
Implement multiple and hierarchical inheritance.
Write a Python program to demonstrate method overriding using inheritance.
Implement push and pop algorithms of stack using list.
Implement a program to convert infix notation to postfix notation using stack.
Implement recursive functions.
Implement a program to implement QUEUE using list that performs following operations: ENQUEUE, DEQUEUE, DISPLAY

Implement program to perform following operation on singly linked list: a. Insert a node at the beginning of a singly linked list. b. Insert a node at the end of a singly linked list. c. Insert a node after the given node of a singly linked list. d. Insert a node before the given node of singly linked list. e. Delete a node from the beginning of a singly linked list. f. Delete a node from the end of a singly linked list. g. Count the number of nodes of a singly linked list. h. Display content of singly linked list
Implement a python program to search a particular element from list using Linear and Binary Search.
Implement Bubble sort algorithm.
Implement Selection sort and Insertion sort algorithm.
Implement Merge sort algorithm.
Implement construction of binary search trees.

Write a menu driven program to perform following operation on Binary Search Tree: a. Create a BST. b. Insert an element in BST. c. Pre-order traversal of BST. d. In-order traversal of BST. e. Post-order traversal of BST. f. Delete an element from BST

performanceIndicators.indicator: Identify suitable approach to implement logic
Use python concepts to implement efficient program
Follow different input test cases to check output
Identify and mend coding errors in a program / Interpret the result and conclude

hardware: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher Ver., macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM, Python versions: 2.7.X, 3.6.X or higher
software: Python IDEs and Code Editors Open Source : IDLE, Jupyter

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.

unitOutcomes.description: Define linear and non-linear data structures.
Define time complexity and space complexity.
Explain python specific - list, tuple, set, Dictionary and tuple data structures.
Describe the Operations on arrays.
Differentiate array and list.

topics.title: Analysis Terms (for the definitions purpose only)
Python Specific Data Structures - List, Tuple, Set, Dictionary

unitOutcomes.description: Explain concepts of Object Oriented programming.
Explain the concept of class and object.
Use a constructor to initialize an object.
List the types of Inheritance.
Use Inheritance to create re-usable codes in Python.
Understand Polymorphism.
Describe Abstract class.

topics.title: Inheritance - single, multiple, multi-level, hierarchical, hybrid

unitOutcomes.description: Implement Stack Operations using List.
List applications of Stack.
Convert the given expression from Infix to Prefix/Postfix using stack.
Evaluate the postfix expression using stack.
Implement Queue Operations using List.
Explain concepts of Circular queue.
List applications of Queue.
Differentiate circular and simple queues.

topics.title: Application of Stack - Infix, Prefix and Postfix Forms of Expressions, Evaluations of postfix expression
Operations on Queue - Enqueue and Dequeue
Differentiate circular queue and simple queue

unitOutcomes.description: Define a linked list.
List types of Linked List.
Implement basic operations on singly linked lists.
Explain concepts of circular linked lists.
Differentiate between circular linked list and singly linked list.
Explain concepts of doubly linked lists.
List applications of Linked List.

topics.title: Basic operations on singly linked list
subtopics: Insertion of a new node in the beginning of the list, at the end of the list, after a given node, before a given node
Deleting the first and last node from a linked list
Count the number of nodes in linked list

topics.title: Difference between circular linked list and singly linked list

unitOutcomes.description: Design and Implement search algorithms.
Arrange data in ascending and descending orders using appropriate sorting algorithms.
Explain the working of the given sorting method step-by-step with an example and small data set.
Describe a binary tree.
Draw binary search tree for the given data set.
Write algorithms to traverse the tree using the given method.
List applications of trees.

topics.title: Binary trees: Complete Binary Tree, Basic Terms: level number, degree, in-degree and out-degree, leaf node
Binary Search Tree: Insertion of a node in binary tree, Deletion of a node in binary tree, Searching a node in binary tree

studentActivities: Give a seminar on any relevant topics.
Prepare a chart to classify Data structures.
Explore different python data structure modules.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students for finding suitable data structures to solve given problems.

microProjects.title: Phone directory application using doubly-linked lists
microProjects.description: This project can demonstrate the working of contact book applications and also teach you about data structures like arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues. Typically, phone book management encompasses searching, sorting, and deleting operations. A distinctive feature of the search queries here is that the user sees suggestions from the contact list after entering each character.

microProjects.title: Hangman Game
microProjects.description: The Hangman program randomly selects a secret word from a list of secret words. A random word (Eg. a fruit name) is picked up from our collection and the player gets limited chances to win the game. When a letter in that word is guessed correctly, that letter position in the word is made visible. In this way, all letters of the word are to be guessed before all the chances are over.

microProjects.title: Stack and queue implementation using linked list
microProjects.description: Develop a python program that implements stack and queue operations using linked list representation.
